clinical_study.brief_title: An Individualized Physical Activity Program in Patients Over 65 Years With Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: An Interventional Prospective Study to Test the Feasibility of an Individualized Physical Activity Program in Patients Over 65 Years of Age With Hematologic Malignancies: the OCAPI Project.

brief_summary.textblock:
Older people with cancer differ from younger patients due to the combined effects of aging, comorbidities and cancer treatments on their health. In acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and non-hodgkin lymphoma (NHL), chemotherapy, which is the main treatment, is associated with significant toxicity that negatively affects patients' physical capacities and quality of life, already declining with age and comorbidities. It therefore seems essential to develop and evaluate interventions that can prevent physical and psychosocial decline and its consequences in these populations. However, no studies have evaluated a physical activity (PA) program among these populations, although the absence of risk of implementing PA during intense therapeutic procedures has been confirmed.
OCAPI is an interdisciplinary, prospective, interventional, feasibility study. It is intended to include 20 AML and 20 NHL patients 65 years of age or older at the time of initiation of the first chemotherapy line, with an ECOG <3, with no contraindications to PA and no history or coexistence of other primary cancer.
Expected results are to demonstrate that a program offering supervised sessions in a sterile room or at home and remote support can enable patients with AML or NHL to perform their daily PA in autonomy. All these results will generate preliminary data before implementing a larger national study.

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance rate of the physical activity sessions
primary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of supervised and unsupervised sessions performed by patients / number of scheduled sessions

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance rate of the phone calls
primary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of phone calls performed / number of scheduled calls

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance rate of the activity tracker
primary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of days wearing the activity tracker / number of days of the program

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of the number of patients still in the program / number of patients included in the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on autonomy for activities of daily living

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on autonomy for instrumental activities of daily living
secondary_outcome.description: Instrumental activities of Daily Living questionnaire (IADL) - scale from 0 to 4, 0=autonomy; 4 = no autonomy

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on upper body strength
secondary_outcome.description: 30-s Arm Curl Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on lower body strength
secondary_outcome.description: 30-s Chair Stand Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on upper body flexibility
secondary_outcome.description: Back Scratch Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on lower body flexibility
secondary_outcome.description: Chair Sit and Reach Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on agility
secondary_outcome.description: Timed Up and Go Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on walking endurance
secondary_outcome.description: 6-min Walk Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on walking speed
secondary_outcome.description: 10-m Walk Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on balance
secondary_outcome.description: Open-eyes Unipodal Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on grip strength
secondary_outcome.description: Hand Grip Dynamometer Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on anthropometrics
secondary_outcome.description: BMI (weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on nutrition
secondary_outcome.description: Mini Nutritional Assessment (MNA) - scale from 0 to 30 points; score<17=bad nutritional status ; 17 and 23.5=risk of malnutrition ; >24: adaptednutritional status

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on cognition
secondary_outcome.description: Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) ; scale from 0 to 30; normal if score >16

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on depression
secondary_outcome.description: Geriatric Depression Scale-15 (GDS-15) ; scale from 0 to 15 ; 0 to 5=normal ; 6 and 9 = high probability of depression ; > 9 = almost systematic depression

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on self-efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: Self-efficacy for exercise scale - This scale has a range of total scores from 0-90. A higher score indicates higher self-efficacy for exercise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on comorbidities
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulativ Illness Rating Scale - Geriatric (CIRS-G) ; 14 items ; for each one, score from 0 to 4 : 0=no problem and 4=serious issue

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on health-related quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer core quality of life questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30) - scale from 0 to 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-F) ; score from 0 to 65 ; the higher the score is, the less the patient has fatigue

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on the level of physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Godin-Shephard Leisure-Time Physical Activity Questionnaire (GSLTPAQ) ; Godin scale score: < 14 units: insufficiently active/sedentary ; 14-23: moderately active ; 24 or more : active

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on exercise barriers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At inclusion, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Barriers to Being Active Quiz

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on social vulnerability
secondary_outcome.description: Évaluation de la précarité et des inégalités de santé pour les CES (EPICES questionnaire) - scale from 0 to 100, 0= no social vulnerability, 100=max vulnerability, threshold=30

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the program on falls
secondary_outcome.description: Number of falls

intervention.description: Participants who agreed to participate in the study will participate in an individualized 6-month physical activity (PA) program, consisting of 3 periods: initiation (1st month), transition (2nd-3rd months) and autonomy (4th-6th months). It is based on 4 PA modalities: The supervised PA session in a sterile room or at home once a week during the initiation and transition phases (20-45 min, low-to-moderate intensity, walking, muscle strengthening, balance and flexibility exercises). The unsupervised PA session in a sterile room or at home once a week during the transition phase and twice a week during the autonomy phase (same as supervised session). Follow-up by telephone once a month during the autonomy phase (30 min, support to PA). Continuously wearing an activity tracker throughout the entire program (promotion of walking). Activities are planned over a period of 6 months to achieve an intervention that meets the key principles of progression, specificity and empowerment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 65 and over,
- With histologically confirmed non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) or acute myeloid leukemia (AML),
- Requiring a first line of chemotherapy treatment,
- Followed-up in one of the investigating centers,
- Residing in one of the following departments: Ain, Ardèche, Drôme, Isère, Loire, Rhône, Savoie, Haute-Savoie,
- Having a ECOG < 3,
- With a life expectancy > 6 months,
- Whose ability to engage in physical activity has been certified by a medical certificate issued by the investigator physician,
- Available and willing to participate in the study for the duration of the intervention and follow-up,
- Able to understand, read and write French,
- Affiliated with a social security scheme,
- Having dated and signed an informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Personal history or co-existence of another primary cancer (except of in situ cancer regardless of the site and/or basal cell skin cancer and/or non-mammary cancer in complete remission for more than 5 years),
- Treated by immunotherapy alone,
- Participating in concurrent physical activity studies,
- Deprived of their liberty by court or administrative decision.
